class_notes: Forensic anthropology is an applied field of biological anthropology that focuses on field and laboratory methods for the recovery and analysis of human skeletal remains from medicolegal contexts.  This course serves as an introduction to the theory and methods of the field.  Topics include the scope and theory of forensic anthropological practice, human osteology, the biological profile, decomposition processes, skeletal trauma, individuation, ethics, and application of forensic anthropology to human rights abuses.  Please note this class may include discussion and images of human remains in various stages of decomposition and handling skeletonized remains.
course_description: Advanced seminar or lecture series on topics of anthropological concern. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
